values.title: MATLAB on Windows throws "Service call timed out" error

content.raw:
Hello,

We have set up handsim on a Ubuntu 14.04 computer and configured the network parameters. 

On a Windows 7 computer, we installed Visual Studio 2013 and MATLAB 2016b then downloaded the latest release of Client SDK from this [link ](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=haptix_install&cat=haptix). 

However, when we try to run hx_matlab_controller.m, it gives us the following error:

```
hx_robot_info() Service call timed out.
Error using hxgz
Failed to get robot info

Error in hx_connect (line 26)
  hxgz('connect');
```

We also tried running Octave from the same computer and also from another Ubuntu 14.04 by setting network parameters and in both cases we were able to run and successfully move the hand.
content.html:
Hello,

We have set up handsim on a Ubuntu 14.04 computer and configured the network parameters.

On a Windows 7 computer, we installed Visual Studio 2013 and MATLAB 2016b then downloaded the latest release of Client SDK from this link .

However, when we try to run hx_matlab_controller.m, it gives us the following error:

hx_robot_info() Service call timed out.
Error using hxgz
Failed to get robot info

Error in hx_connect (line 26)
  hxgz('connect');

We also tried running Octave from the same computer and also from another Ubuntu 14.04 by setting network parameters and in both cases we were able to run and successfully move the hand.

values.title: Cannot Specify Desired Hand Model for Dual-Hand Control

content.raw: I am trying to control right and left MPLs simultaneously through Octave for a dual-hand simulation. However, I cannot specify which hand model to control, and it seems like the hand manipulated changes randomly at every restart of the simulation even though I specify an arm model while connecting the simulation from Octave via hx_connect, e.g., hx_connect('mpl_haptix_x_forearm').
content.html: I am trying to control right and left MPLs simultaneously through Octave for a dual-hand simulation. However, I cannot specify which hand model to control, and it seems like the hand manipulated changes randomly at every restart of the simulation even though I specify an arm model while connecting the simulation from Octave via hx_connect, e.g., hx_connect('mpl_haptix_x_forearm').

content.raw:
I am very interested in Haptix project, when I using this project, I met some problems. 

1) How to get the position (x,y,z coordinates) of the arm and the cube with some programming languages, maybe C language ? I have searched related information, I guess I can implement this by using _hxsModel struct, but I do not know how to connect the arm and cube with this struct. 

2) How to control the whole arm with C API ? As introduced in C API, I can use C language to control the arm, but I can only control the motors. However, wiith keyboard, I can control the whole arm by pressing 'W' 'S' 'A' 'D'. Can I write C codes to implement this kind of control ?
content.html:
I am very interested in Haptix project, when I using this project, I met some problems.

1) How to get the position (x,y,z coordinates) of the arm and the cube with some programming languages, maybe C language ? I have searched related information, I guess I can implement this by using _hxsModel struct, but I do not know how to connect the arm and cube with this struct.

2) How to control the whole arm with C API ? As introduced in C API, I can use C language to control the arm, but I can only control the motors. However, wiith keyboard, I can control the whole arm by pressing 'W' 'S' 'A' 'D'. Can I write C codes to implement this kind of control ?

content.raw:
I get the following error while trying to build handsim on Ubuntu 16.04:


```
#!
usr/include/boost/type_traits/detail/has_binary_operator.hp:50: Parse error at "BOOST_JOIN" 
src/CMakeFiles/HaptixGUIPlugin.dir/build.make:62: recipe for target 'src/__/include/handsim/moc_HaptixGUIPlugin.cxx' failed 
make[2]: *** [src/__/include/handsim/moc_HaptixGUIPlugin.cxx] Error 1 
CMakeFiles/Makefile2:125: recipe for target 'src/CMakeFiles/HaptixGUIPlugin.dir/all' failed 
make[1]: *** [src/CMakeFiles/HaptixGUIPlugin.dir/all] Error 2 
Makefile:160: recipe for target 'all' failed 
make: *** [all] Error 2


```

I am new to Gazebo, in general. Is there any way around this issue?
